text:
So the approach usually taken for this would be to add a field and use hubl to display that (you can set defaults/fallbacks) - see: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/module-theme-fields>

So for a “Blog header” image you’d create a “image” field: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#image>

and then you could access this in your template using hubl.
Although it does depend on how you’re building your template.

Newbie question. When a page is created using a new hubdb theme template and I then change the template it was built from, changes don't seem to be carrie through to the page. Is this normal? IE when the page is created from a template, does this mean future changes to the template will not affect that page?
